msDesc.head: Siboto, Sermones de Miserere; Richard the Premonstratensian, De canone missae; Bonaventure, Breviloquium pauperis. Germany; A) (fols. 2-42) s. xiii2 || B) (fols. 43-102) s. xiv1

physDesc.p: This description is abbreviated from Daniela Mairhofer, Medieval Manuscripts from the Mainz Charterhouse in the Bodleian Library, Oxford: A Descriptive Catalogue (Oxford, 2018), pp. 899–906. For purposes of scholarly citation, reference to the printed catalogue is requested.

binding.p: Brown tanned calf over laminated pulpboard for Abp. Laud, 1637–1639.

history.provenance: Mainz, Carthusian abbey of St Michael: Composed of two fascicles of different dates, MS. Laud Misc. 319 is likely to have already existed in its current make-up when in the possession of the Mainz Charterhouse, at the latest in the late 14th century.
William Laud, 1573–1645: Ex-libris inscription, dated 1638, at the lower margin of fol. 2r.
history.acquisition: Given to the Bodleian as part of his third donation, dispatched on 28 June 1639.

recordHist.source: See above. Previously described in the Quarto Catalogue (H. O. Coxe, Laudian Manuscripts, Quarto Catalogues II, repr. with corrections, 1969, from the original ed. of 1858–1885). Quarto Catalogue, col. 248 Quarto Catalogue, col. 249 Summary Catalogue, vol. 2, part 1, p. 51

listBibl.head: Published descriptions:
listBibl.bibl: Daniela Mairhofer, Medieval Manuscripts from the Mainz Charterhouse in the Bodleian Library, Oxford: A Descriptive Catalogue, 2 vols. (Oxford, 2018), pp. 899–906

msItem.author: Siboto
msItem.title: Sermones super Psalmum 'Miserere' (Ps. 50)
msItem.note: With tabula (fols. 36va-38rb), listing themes of sermons and subchapters (Schneyer 5. 426f., nos 326–345; Stegmüller, RB, 7628, and suppl.; Schneyer, Wegweiser 369/70; Kaeppeli 3576).

msItem.author: Richard the Premonstratensian
msItem.title: De canone missae
msItem.note: 1-10, text in part different from the edition (PL 177. 455C–470A; Hauréau, Initia, 3. 171vb–172vb, this copy at fol. 172va).
(fol. 42vb) Antiphon, followed by name Gerhardus, bishop of Nowhere ('gerhardus episcopus nullatensis').

layoutDesc.layout:
Ruling in ink, two columns of 39 lines (item 1) and 39-41 lines (item 2). Ruled space
c.140–54 99–106

handDesc.handNote: German textualis, s. xiv1, by two different hands: (item 1) fols 2ra–38rb; (item 2) fols 38rc–42vb. Antiphon inserted on fol. 42vb. Several marginalia in a contemprary hand and s. xv hand of Mainz Charterhouse.

decoDesc.decoNote: Coloured initial in red (fol. 2ra) added by hand from the Mainz Charterhouse, s. xivex/xv.
Unfilled spaces for initials and rubrication.

history.provenance: Mainz, Carthusian abbey of St Michael: the late 14th-cent. ex-libris inscriptions at the head of fol. 2r: ‘Iste liber est fratrum Montis sancti Mychahelis prope Mogunciam ordinis Carthusiensis’. Identifiable with K XV T in cat. ii.

msItem.author: Bonaventure
msItem.title: Breuiloquium pauperis seu Compendium sacrae Scripturae
msItem.note: With prologue (fol. 43ra) and table of chapters (fol. 47rb, l. 29). Chapter divisions occasionally vary from edition (pr.: GW 4644, 4646–48; 4650–55; 4661; ed.: Little 97; Glorieux, Rép., 305k; Stegmüller, RS, 117; Distelbrink 1; Mohan 152*f.; Bloomfield 2149, and suppl.).

supportDesc.support: parchment; bookmarks made of plain thread sewn into the outer margins, to indicate the beginning of parts 6 and 7 and the end of the item.

layoutDesc.layout:
Ruling in lead point, two columns of 36 lines. Ruled space
c.133–36 82–85

handDesc.handNote: German textualis, s. xiii2, by a single hand. Several marginalia in hands of s. xiv; (fol. 47r, ll. 25–30) text inserted, presumably over erasure; a correcting hand of s. xv (fol. 47ra-rb).

decoDesc.decoNote: Flourished initial in blue and red (fol. 43ra).
Rubrication by the scribe and in a hand of s. xv from the Mainz Charterhouse.
Drawings in lead point in the margins, mostly leaves, occasionally initials (fols 52v, 61r, 62v, 63v, 64r and 71r); Christ crucified, with halo (fol. 62v).

history.provenance: Mainz, Carthusian abbey of St Michael: the late 14th-cent. ex-libris inscriptions at the lower centre of fol. 43r: ‘Liber carthusiensium prope mogunciam’ (boxed in), and at the lower margin of fol. 102v: ‘Fratrum Cartusiensium prope mogunciam.’, each in a different hand.

revisionDesc.change: Description revised for Mainz digitization project to include additional information from Mairhofer catalogue.
James Cummings Up-converted the markup using https://github.com/jamescummings/Bodleian-msDesc-ODD/blob/master/convertTolkien2Bodley.xsl
